alert.note: Alert for Hatteras Island; Northern Outer Banks (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 26 at 4:52AM EDT until September 27 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 PM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Up to 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Areas along the beaches from Duck to Cape Hatteras. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 9 PM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Up to 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level is possible due to ocean overwash resulting in a low threat of property damage. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes adjacent to the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Elevated water levels are likely beginning with Tuesday afternoon`s high tide, but only limited impacts are expected until early Wednesday morning. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Duck NC MLLW Categories - Minor 5.5 ft, Moderate 6.0 ft, Major 6.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.8 ft, Moderate 2.3 ft, Major 2.8 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 26/05 AM 4.3 0.6 0.8 3 None 26/06 PM 5.8 2.1 1.6 3-4 Minor 27/06 AM 5.9 2.2 2.0 6-7 Minor 27/06 PM 6.3 2.6 2.1 7-8 Moderate 28/06 AM 5.7 2.0 1.7 7 Minor 28/07 PM 5.7 2.0 1.4 6 Minor &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
